page.title: 13POP_IN
page.content: On one of our Domesday visits we went to the Pop_In. It is a place were elderly people go to enjoy themselves. If younger people go there they will never turn them away. When you go in there is a notice which shows you the fixed rota for the day and for the rest of the week. The person incharge of the Pop_In is Margaret Dooly.The people who help there are all volunteers. The things they do are knitting,sewing,art and crafts, darts, snooker and other activities. To keep the Pop_In going they have to raise Â£45,000 every year. They do this by collecting clothes and teddys and making things out of them to sell. Food is provided by the council for 65 pence per meal. We think that the Pop_In is a good idea because some elderly people might not have anybody to go to, or to talk to.Sharon Bigger.
